Type.Name: UriBuilder

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit UriBuilder extends System.Object

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

remarks.para: The class provides a convenient way to modify the contents of a instance without creating a new instance for each modification.
The properties provide read/write access to the read-only properties so that they can be modified.

summary.para: Provides a custom constructor for uniform resource identifiers (URIs) and modifies URIs for the class.

remarks.para: The method compares a specified instance with the instance built by the instance. If the two are the same, the method returns true.

returns.para: true if represents the same as the constructed by this instance; otherwise, false.

Docs.param: The object to compare with the current instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Fragment { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_Fragment() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Fragment(string value) }
public string Fragment { get; set; }
.property instance string Fragment

value.para: A containing the fragment component of the URI represented by the current instance.

remarks.para: The property contains any text following a fragment marker (#) in the URI, including the marker itself. When setting the property, the fragment marker is added to its value. Note In version 1.0 and 1.1 of the .NET Framework, setting the property to any value, including null, cleared the property, and setting the property to null or to cleared the property. In version 2.0, however, the and properties are independent.

Note Do not append a string directly to this property. If the length of is greater than 1, retrieve the property value as a string, remove the leading pound sign, append the new query string, and set the property with the combined string.

summary.para: Gets or sets the fragment portion of the URI.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual int32 GetHashCode()
public override int GetHashCode ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetHashCode() cil managed

remarks.para: The hash code is generated without including any fragment. The URIs http://www.contoso.com/index.htm#search and http://www.contoso.com/index.htm generate the same hash code.
The hash codes for A and B are guaranteed to be the same when A.Equals(B) is true.
This method implements .

summary.para: Returns the hash code for the URI.

returns.para: The hash code generated for the URI.

public string Host { get; set; }

value.para: A containing the DNS host name or IP address of the host machine.

remarks.para: The property contains the fully qualified DNS host name or IP address of the server.

summary.para: Gets or sets the Domain Name System (DNS) host name or IP address of a server.

summary.para: Gets or sets the password associated with the user that accesses the URI.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Path { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_Path() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Path(string value) }
public string Path { get; set; }
.property instance string Path

value.para: A containing the path to the resource represented by the current instance.

remarks.para: The property contains the path information that the server uses to resolve requests for information. Typically this is the path to the desired information on the server's file system; although it also can indicate the application or script that the server must run to provide the information.
The path information does not include the scheme, host name, or query portion of the URI. The property always returns at least a slash (/).

summary.para: Gets or sets the path to the resource referenced by the URI.

MemberSignature.Value: .property int32 Port { public hidebysig specialname instance int32 get_Port() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Port(int32 value) }
public int Port { get; set; }
.property instance int32 Port

value.para: A containing a non-negative port number or -1.

Docs.exception: The value specified for a set operation was less than zero.

remarks.para: The port number defines the protocol port for contacting the host referenced in the URI. If a port is not specified as part of the URI, the property returns the value of -1 to indicate that the default port value for the protocol scheme will be used to connect to the host. If the property is set to a value of -1, this indicates that the default port value for the protocol scheme will be used to connect to the host.

summary.para: Gets or sets the port number of the URI.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Query { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_Query() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Query(string value) }
public string Query { get; set; }
.property instance string Query

value.para: A containing the query component of the URI represented by the current instance.

remarks.para: The property contains any query information included in the URI. Query information is separated from the path information by a question mark (?) and continues to the end of the URI. The query information returned includes the leading question mark.
The query information is escaped according to RFC 2396.

Note In version 1.0 and 1.1 of the .NET Framework, setting the property to any value, including null, cleared the property, and setting the property to null or to cleared the property. In version 2.0, however, the and properties are independent.

Note Do not append a string directly to this property. If the length of is greater than 1, retrieve the property value as a string, remove the leading question mark, append the new query string, and set the property with the combined string.

summary.para: Gets or sets any query information included in the URI.

MemberSignature.Value: .property string Scheme { public hidebysig specialname instance string get_Scheme() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_Scheme(string value) }
public string Scheme { get; set; }
.property instance string Scheme

value.para: A containing the scheme component of the current instance.

remarks.para: The following table lists the valid scheme names for the property.

description.para: The resource is a file on the local computer.
The resource is accessed through FTP.
The resource is accessed through the Gopher protocol.
The resource is accessed through HTTP.
The resource is accessed through SSL-encrypted HTTP.
The resource is an e-mail address and is accessed through SMTP.
The resource is accessed through NNTP.

summary.para: Gets or sets the scheme name of the URI.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual string ToString()
public override string ToString ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

remarks.para: The display string contains the property value if the property was set or the port was specified when the was constructed using of the methods that accept a port number parameter except for the case when the .property value was set to a value of -1 to indicate the default port.

The display string does not contain the property value if the property was not set and a port was not specified when the was constructed. The display string also does not contain the property value if the property or port number for the constructor was set to a value of -1.

summary.para: Returns the display string for the specified instance.

returns.para: The string that contains the unescaped display string of the .

Docs.exception: The URI constructed using the string representation of the current instance is in an invalid form.

remarks.para: The property contains the created by the . Any changes made to the properties are reflected in the property.

summary.para: Gets the instance constructed by the specified instance.
